item.title: Please Don't Say These Six Things at My Funeral
item.description:
Please Don't Say These Six Things at My Funeral

Some challenging thoughts here to cut through sentimentalities.

item.title: The Christian Century No One Predicted
item.description:
The Christian Century No One Predicted

An intriguing title.  A little realized fact.

item.title: Spurgeon's Sorrows: Realistic Hope for those who suffer from depression
item.description:
Spurgeon's Sorrows: Realistic Hope for those who suffer from depression

This book comes highly recommended from those who suffer from depression. It is written by a master, the great Baptist preacher Charles Spurgeon who suffered from depression himself. It is on offer on kindle at the moment and is not expensive in paperback.

item.title: Hope Beyond Cure
item.description:
Hope Beyond Cure

A book for those with terminal cancer written by someone with terminal cancer.  Is there hope when there is no cure?

item.title: Does Islam Inevitably Lead to Violence?
item.description:
Does Islam Inevitably Lead to Violence?

Not that long ago, most Americans didn't know much or care to know much about Islam. It was just one more exotic but irrelevant religion that missionaries and National Geographic occassionally talked about. One scholar noted, "Less than a year before September 11, 2001, the consensus of expert opinion was .

item.title: Janelle Hail - I Am Second
item.description:
Janelle Hail - I Am Second

What can God be doing through cancer?  Listen to an inspiring story.

item.title: Atheism in decline and will be defeated by faith, says Oxford professor
item.description:
Atheism in decline and will be defeated by faith, says Oxford professor

Atheism is in decline and will be trumped by faith, the professor of science and religion at the University of Oxford has said. Professor Alister McGrath made his predictions during the annual Parchman Lectures at Baylor University's Truett Theological Seminary, the Baptist Standard reports.

item.title: The girl in the picture
item.description:
The girl in the picture

Can anyone survive tragedy, like Paris? And even come to faith through it?
